Package org.thedryden.workmanager

Class Worker

java.lang.Object
org.thedryden.workmanager.Worker
All Implemented Interfaces:
WorkerInterface
public abstract class Worker
extends java.lang.Object
implements WorkerInterface
Default implementation of the WorkerInterface. There really shouldn't be much need to ever not use this abstract class, but if you want feel free to code your own.
Author:
Matthew Dryden

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors 
    Constructor Description
    Worker()
    Creates a new worker with no precedenceConstraint.

    Methods inherited from interface org.thedryden.workmanager.WorkerInterface

    worker

  • Constructor Details

    • Worker

      public Worker()
      Creates a new worker with no precedenceConstraint. If you want to have a precedenceConstraint or a threadName that is not the default either overwrite this method, but still call super, or set those values when adding this to a worker pool.

  • Method Details

    • addPrecedenceConstraint

      public Worker addPrecedenceConstraint​(java.lang.String precedenceConstraint)
      Adds a precedenceConstraint to the set of precedenceConstraint, creating a new set if nessisary
      Parameters:
      precedenceConstraint - a thread name you wish to add to the precedenceConstraint
      Returns:
      this - for method chaining

    • setThreadName

      public void setThreadName​(java.lang.String threadName)
      Used to set the threadName to something other than the default: this.getClass().getSimpleName()

      public java.lang.String getThreadNameAppend​(java.lang.String append)
      Returns the thread name, with the provided string appended to the end
      Parameters:

      the thread name, with the provided string appended to the end

    • getStatus

      public Status getStatus()
      Returns the current status of this worker
      Specified by:
      getStatus in interface WorkerInterface

    • setStatus

      public void setStatus​(Status status)
      Sets the current status of this worker. You should never need to call this manually, this is designed to be used by WorkerPool class.
      Specified by:
      setStatus in interface WorkerInterface

    • run

      public void run()
      This method is designed to call worker class, while managing both the classes status and error handling and basic logging / timing.
      Specified by:
      run in interface WorkerInterface
